citeinfo.origin: AHTNA/Copper River Native Association contract to Institute of Social and Economic Research, University of Alaska, Anchorage
citeinfo.title: Native Routes in The Ahtna Region

descript.abstract: Data Type: Subsistence/Traditional Knowledge; Automation of the Ahtna native routes as provided by James Kari in Tatl'ahwt'aenn nenn, the headwaters People's Country. This is a layer in the Copper River Native Association Subsistence Database 1995. (Record#061)

idinfo.accconst: A version of the database with individual names removed will be delivered to BLM and NPS.
idinfo.useconst: The database will have a restriction on publication of subsistence site information where such publication could lead to trespass and vandalization of sites.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metac: A version of the database with individual names removed will be delivered to BLM and NPS.
